alert.note: Alert for Mason (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 11:19AM EST until February 21 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Charleston WV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...West Virginia... Ohio River At Racine Lock affecting Meigs and Mason Counties. For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River At Racine Lock. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, Ohio State Route 124 at Antiquity starts to flood. Areas of Ravenswood are flooded upstream from Racine Lock. At 42.0 feet, Ohio Route 124 near Minersville is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 29.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 42.6 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 42.7 feet on 01/11/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
